head.title: Political Briefing; Loophole Inspires Legislative End Run

hedline.hl1: Political Briefing; Loophole Inspires Legislative End Run

abstract.p: Wyoming Legislature passes proposed constitutional amendment to curtail governor's veto power and informs secretary of state that measure can go before voters without signature of Gov Jim Geringer; Geringer challenges legality of maneuver in court (S)

block.p: Last year, Gov. Jim Geringer of Wyoming vetoed a bill that proposed a constitutional amendment to curtail veto power by governors. This year the Legislature tried again.

But in the second go-round, legislators sent the bill directly to the secretary of state for action after passage, saying they had found a loophole in state law that permitted constitutional amendment measures to bypass the governor's desk.

But in the second go-round, legislators sent the bill directly to the secretary of state for action after passage, saying they had found a loophole in state law that permitted constitutional amendment measures to bypass the governor's desk.
Mr. Geringer says he is going to court to get a ruling on the legality of the end run.
''This is a lesson in civics,'' he said last week. ''I have an obligation as governor to be sure that process is followed. It was not.''
